Welcome to Heart_Rate_Sentinel’s documentation!¶

hrserver.User(*args, **kwargs)¶

This class initializes the stored data fields for the heart rate sentinel Mongo database.

hrserver.mrn¶

specifies patient MRN.

Type:string
hrserver.attending_email¶

specifies patient’s attending physician’s email.

Type:email
hrserver.user_age¶

specifies patient’s age in years.

Type:float
hrserver.heart_rate¶

contains all the stored heart rate data

Type:list
hrserver.heart_rate_timestamp¶

contains associated timestamps of heart_rate data

Type:list
hrserver.greeting()¶

Welcomes user to heart rate sentinel

This function returns the following string: “Welcome to the heart rate sentinel”

Returns:“Welcome to the heart rate sentinel”
Return type:welcome (string)
hrserver.getData(patient_id)¶

This function returns all the stored information for a patient as a JSON dictionary

Parameters:patient_id (string) – string specifying patient MRN.
Returns:dictionary of stored information for specified patient
Return type:dict_array (dict)
hrserver.getStatus(patient_id)¶

This function returns whether the specified patient is currently tachycardic based on previously available heart rate data, as well as the timestamp of the most recent heart rate. Furthermore, it also sends an email to the attending physician if the patient is tachycardic.

Parameters:patient_id (string) – specifies patient MRN.
Returns:specifies if patient is tachycardic
Return type:ans (string)
hrserver.getHR(patient_id)¶

This function returns all the previously stored heart rate data as a string for a specified patient.

Parameters:patient_id (string) – specifies patient MRN.
Returns:stored heart rate data
Return type:total_stored_hr_data (str)
hrserver.getavgHR(patient_id)¶

This function returns an average of all the stored heart rate data for a specified patient

Parameters:patient_id (string) – specifies patient MRN.
Returns:sentence that informs user of patients average heart rate
Return type:ans (str)
hrserver.addHr()¶

Posts heart rate data to database and checks for tachycardia

This function receives a JSON request and posts the new data to the specified patient’s heart rate data. It also checks for tachycardia, and emails the physician if tachycardia is detected. The function returns a string explaining the most recent heart rate status of the patient. Furthermore, it removes the initialized heart rate value (0) and associated time stamp.

Parameters:patient_id (string) – specifies patient MRN (received through JSON request).
Returns:sentence that informs user of patients recent heart rate status
Return type:status (str)
hrserver.addpatient()¶

This function receives a JSON request and initializes the database variables for the new patient.

Parameters:
  • mrn (string) – specifies patient MRN.
  • attending_email (email) – specifies patient’s attending physician’s email.
  • user_age (float) – specifies patient’s age in years.
  • heart_rate (list) – stored heart rate data
  • heart_rate_timestamp (list) – associated timestamps of heart_rate data
Returns:

identifies patient. No two patients can have the same MRN.
Return type:

u.mrn (str)
hrserver.intervalaverage()¶

This function calculates the average of the stored heart rates after a specified time point.

Parameters:
  • patient_id (string) – specifies patient MRN (received through JSON request).
  • heart_rate_average_since (string) – time string to specify time point for interval average.
Returns:

identifies patient. No two patients can have the same MRN.
Return type:

u.mrn (str)
hrserver.email(from_email_string, to_email_string, subject, content_string)¶

This function utilizes the SendGrid API to send an email.

Parameters:
  • from_email_string (string) – specifies the email address the message will be sent from.
  • to_email_string (string) – specifies the email address the message will be sent to.
  • subject (string) – specifies subject of the email
  • content_string (string) – specifies the content of the email
Returns:

code to inform user of email status
Return type:

response.status_code (int)
hrserver.recondition(heart_rate_average_since, heart_rate_timestamp, heart_rate)¶

This function compares the specified time point to the timestamps of the heart rate data and returns a heart rate vector containing data for the interval specified.

Parameters:
  • heart_rate (array) – numpy array of heart rate data.
  • heart_rate_average_since (datetime) – datetime object for specified interval
  • heart_rate_timestamp (array) – numpy array of datetimes corresponding to heart rate data
Returns:

list of hr data in specified interval
Return type:

reconditioned_hr_data (list)
hrserver.istachycardic(user_age, hr)¶

This function determines if a patient of a specified age is tachycardic .

Parameters:
  • user_age (float) – patient age in years.
  • hr (float) – heart rate in beats per minute.
Returns:

specifies whether patient is tachycardic
Return type:

tachy (boolean)
hrserver.averageHR(hr)¶

This function calculates the average of a list.

Parameters:hr (list) – list of hr data
Returns:average heart rate
Return type:avg (float)
